transform_relation.comment: Replace the missing data types with an arbitrary default.
Concatenate the primary keys and move them to the end of the table.
Move the foreign keys to the end of the table.

Prefix any 'FOREIGN KEY fk1 REFERENCES T (fk1) 
 FOREIGN KEY fk2 REFERENCES T (fk2)' with 'FOREIGN KEY (fk1, fk2) REFERENCES T (fk1, fk2)'
transform_relation.replace:
FOREIGN KEY (\1, \5) REFERENCES \2 (\3, \6),
- FOREIGN KEY (\1) REFERENCES \2 (\3),
- FOREIGN KEY (\5) REFERENCES \2 (\6),
\4

transform_relation.comment: Prefix any FOREIGN KEY with a minus sign = mark it as unprotected.

transform_relational_schema.comment: Suppress the minus sign before any FOREIGN KEY line which references an actual PRIMARY KEY declared before this line.
Suppress the minus sign before any FOREIGN KEY line which references an actual PRIMARY KEY declared after this line = protect it.
Suppress any unprotected line = still starting with a minus sign.
Move all foreign keys constraints at the end of the document
Comment out foreign keys referencing commented tables.
